meanings.definition: The state of being captivated or charmed.
meanings.sent1: Her captivation with the story kept her glued to the book all night.
meanings.sent2: The movie's captivation of the audience was evident from their rapt attention.
meanings.sent3: His captivation with magic tricks often left his friends in awe.
meanings.sent4: The captivation of the young minds by the wonders of nature was truly magical.
meanings.sent5: The captivation of the little girl by the colorful butterflies was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of captivating or enchanting.
meanings.sent1: The captivation of the audience by the magician's tricks was astounding.
meanings.sent2: Her captivation of the judges with her singing talent earned her a standing ovation.
meanings.sent3: The captivation of the children by the puppet show brought smiles to their faces.
meanings.sent4: The captivation of the crowd by the street performer's dance was infectious.
meanings.sent5: The captivation of the visitors by the museum's artifacts was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The quality of being captivating or enchanting.
meanings.sent1: The captivation of the painting lay in its intricate details.
meanings.sent2: His captivation of the audience with his storytelling skills was unmatched.
meanings.sent3: The captivation of the puppy with the squeaky toy provided endless entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The captivation of the travelers by the scenic beauty of the countryside was unforgettable.
meanings.sent5: The captivation of the students by the teacher's passion for the subject was inspiring.
